verbose_text: The abnormal activation of NF-kappaB contributes to significant cell proliferation and migration in CRC and in other types of cancer, and the inhibition of NF-kappaB activity has been shown to significantly reduce cancer cell growth and enhance cell apoptosis, indicating that NF-kappaB members are potential therapeutic targets in tumors.
evidence: NF-kappaB activity has been shown to significantly reduce cancer cell growth and enhance cell apoptosis
